isis.stitle: CE 200 AND CE 300 BUS BODY COMPONENTS - INSTALL - Interior Install

svcprocinfo.para: The procedures outlined in this section are the general procedures for the standard items and select options that are most commonly specified.

svcsubproc.title: Step Well
svcsubproc.para: The step well assembly is secured to the floor substructure, body side panel and driver substructure frame. Because portions of the step well assembly are spot welded in place, take the proper precautions in the disconnecting the battery system.

step1.para: Prior to installing the step well assembly, check the floor for holes from the previous step well mounting. If pre-existing holes are found, fill the holes and seal the under structure to prevent leaks that could lead to rust and/or other deterioration.
Align the step well in position with the step well opening. Prior to spot welding the assembly in place, ensure that all surfaces are clean and free of dirt and/or debris.
After the step well assembly is spot welded in place check for open gaps that may allow moisture in the interior.
Seal any open areas.
Check the understructure for clean areas to spot weld the step well assembly to the structures as needed.
All undercoating and paint if applicable should have been removed from the area surrounding the step well mounting points.
Prior to installing the step well, mark and cut out the openings for any courtesy lights that may be mounted in the step well.
With the step well spot welded and screwed into place, re-install the flooring material and trim pieces.
Relocate the step well assist handrail brackets, drill and mount the handrail base assembly.
Remount the passenger entry door assembly, check the alignment of the doors and lower mounting blocks on door cross frame structure.

svcsubproc.title: Assist Handrails
svcsubproc.para: The assist handrail located on the left side of the entry step well is the standard location for the assist rail. An optional assist rail is located on the forward step well bulkhead.
To install the standard step well assist handrail;

step1.para: Locate the hex head mounting hole at the crash barrier panel hand rail attachment point.
Insert the hex head mounting screw and tighten.
Locate the mounting screws on the lower step well handrail mounting brackets, two on each bracket.
Insert the mounting screws. The assist handrail assembly can be mounted in the handrail mounting brackets.
Install the stainless steel handrail in the mounting brackets, locate the set screw on the handrail assist mounting bracket.
Tighten the set screw to secure the handrail.
If the bus is equipped with the optional assist handrail, follow the same basic procedure as outlined in steps 3 through 7.

The top mounting bracket for the forward mounted handrail will be attached with a mounting screw attachment to the forward dash vertical support bracket or the step well optional heater side cover plate.

svcsubproc.title: Defroster Fans (Optional)
svcsubproc.para: The optional defroster fan or fans are mounted on the bulkhead over the windshield area. The fan mounting base is the ground circuit.

step1.para: Locate the mounting holes in the base of the 12 VDC defroster fan, align the fan base mounting holes with the mounting holes in the bulkhead assembly ( Fig. 87, Item 1)
Install the mounting screws and tighten.
Connect the wire leads to the harness connection through the grommet in the bulkhead panel.
When connecting the fan circuits the black wire lead is for low speed, the red wire lead for high speed.
Adjust the fan direction by loosening the spring adjustment screw. Tighten the adjustment screws when fan is in desired position.

svcsubproc.title: Sun Visor
svcsubproc.para: The sun visor mounts to the overhead structure above the driver position.

step1.para: Locate the sun visor assembly bracket on the overhead panel above the driver position.
Locate the mounting holes in the overhead assembly, align the sun visor mounting bracket holes ( Fig. 135, Item 2).
Install the mounting screws in the brackets and into the overhead panel.
Hand tighten all other sun visor fasteners.
Torque all fasteners until tight and still adjustable.

svcsubproc.title: Destination Sign Lights (Optional)
svcsubproc.para: On busses equipped with lighted destination boards front and rear, the light bulbs and socket assemblies are located in the compartment over the windshield in the bulkhead compartment. To replace the bulbs:

step1.para: Open the latching devices on the panel door and lift panel.
Locate the light bulb socket assemblies (6).
Remove the burned out bulb or bulbs and install new bulbs.
Turn on the bus lights to activate the destination board lights. Check bulbs.
Close compartment door and secure latches.

svcsubproc.title: Interior Rear View Mirror
svcsubproc.para: Prior to the installation of replacement glass, the glass should be inspected for small chips. If chips are found, do not install.

warning.para: Always use safety equipment and eye protection when removing or working with glass.

step1.para: Place the mirror glass section on the backing plate. Install the rubber perimeter strip.
Install the metal backing plate assembly on the bulkhead mounting bracket. Align with the bulkhead mounting bracket holes ( Fig. 137, Item 2), both right and left side.
Insert the fasteners and hand tighten.
Adjust mirror to proper position for driver and tighten lock nut.

svcsubproc.title: Dash Board Panels, Cluster and Switch Panels
svcsubproc.para: Prior to installation of the dash panels, check all harness connections, check the defroster duct installation and heater connections.
Driver Side Storage Compartment( Fig. 49)

step1.para: Place the driver storage compartment assembly in place, connect the 12 volt power receptacle plug at the bottom of the storage compartment.
Locate the 6 mounting screw holes in the bottom of the driver storage compartment ( Fig. 143, Item 2), insert the mounting screws and tighten.

svcsubproc.para: Heater and Environmental Controls( Fig. 45, Item 2)

step1.para: Connect the heater, defroster and fan control harness to the system harness.
Locate and install the heater, defroster and recirculation control panel ( Fig. 141, Item 3).
Install the control knobs for the environmental controls.

svcsubproc.para: Driver Left Side Switch Panel( Fig. 45, Item 3)

step1.para: Locate and connect the driver left side switch panel and harness plugs. Connect the switch harness plugs.
Install the switch panel and align the panel mounting holes. Install the mounting screws and tighten ( Fig. 142, Item 1).

svcsubproc.para: Cluster Assembly( Fig. 103, Item 7)

step1.para: Place the instrument cluster in position, locate the harness connections for the instrument cluster and connect.
Seat the cluster and locate the cluster mounting holes and mounting screws ( Fig. 140, Item 1). Insert the mounting screws and tighten.

svcsubproc.para: Cluster Cover Panel( Fig 45, Item 5)

step1.para: Align the instrument cluster cover forward edge mounting holes with the mounting holes along the lower edge of the windshield assembly ( Fig. 103, Items 1 and 2). Insert the mounting bolts and tighten.

svcsubproc.para: Steering Column Cover( S09009)

step1.para: Locate and align the steering column cover panels. Install the mounting screws and tighten.

svcsubproc.para: Right Wing Switch Panel and Cluster Bezel( Fig. 103, Item 6)

step1.para: Locate and install the right wing switch panel, align the panel mounting holes with the mounting holes in the panel support bracket.
With the panel aligned and in place, insert the panel and bezel mounting screws. Tighten the panel screws.
Locate any of the optional equipment mounted on the switch panel. Align with the mounting holes, insert the mounting screws ( Fig. 103, Items 2 and 3), and tighten.

svcsubproc.para: Step Well Panel( Fig. 103, Item 5)

caution.para: Prior to any installation of assemblies that have been attached to the bus interior through the floor assembly, the existing holes must be plugged or filled and or sealed prior to sub-floor installation. All fasteners that protrude the floor assembly must be painted and or under coated to prevent corrosion.

step1.para: Place the step well dash panel in place and align the lower over lap mounting holes.

Align step well forward edge mounting holes ( Fig. 103, Items 3 and 4) with the cluster cover / wing switch panel cover mounting hole and mounting hole at right hand windshield wing panel lower edge of the windshield assembly.
Install the mounting bolts and tighten.
Align the lower edge of the step well panel mounting holes with the mounting holes in the bus cross beam support bracket. Insert the mounting screws and tighten.

svcsubproc.title: Driver Seat
svcsubproc.para: Prior to installation of the driver seat assembly, the mounting hardware should be inspected, and the adjustment mechanisms should be lubricated. The seat belts should be inspected for smooth operation and secure attachment.

step1.para: Clean the driver position platform prior to installation of the driver seat assembly. Locate and check the driver seat mounting holes in the platform area.
Align the driver seat mounting holes on the driver platform floor holes.
Insert the mounting bolts through the seat pedestal and floor ( Fig. 51, Item 5).
With an assistant located under the driver seat platform beneath the floor assembly, install the washers and lock nuts on each of the driver seat mounting bolts. Hand tighten the mounting nuts.
Check the seat mounting for alignment, torque seat anchoring hardware to 20-22 Lbf-ft.

svcsubproc.title: Driver Seat Belts (3-Pt Belt Install)
svcsubproc.para: Check the type of driver seat (for air ride seats) installed and follow the manufacturers recommended procedure for seat belt installation. This procedure requires an assistant under the bus to install the mounting nut and washer.

step1.para: Locate the seat belt latch assembly floor mounting bracket ( Fig. 147, Item 5) and mounting bolt and washer ( Fig. 147, Items 8 and 9).
Align the mounting bracket hole with the mounting hole through the floor on the driver platform.
Insert the mounting bolt and washer through belt assembly attachment.
With the assistant under the driver platform, install the washer and lock nut ( Fig. 147, Items 2 and 3).
Tighten the lock nut to 40-42 Lbf-ft.
Locate the mounting bracket mounting hole on the left side of the driver seat platform floor.
Align and install the floor mounting bracket ( Fig. 147, Item 6) and mounting bolt ( Fig. 147, Item 5) through the bracket and floor assembly.
With the assistant under the driver platform, install the washer and lock nut ( Fig. 147, Items 2 and 3).
Tighten the lock nut to 40-42 Lbf-ft.

Locate the seat belt harness and cover assembly floor mounting bracket ( Fig. 147, Item 7 and 6) on left side of drives position. Install the mounting bolt, washers and lock nut through the belt assembly hardware and floor mounted bracket. Torque to 10-12 Lbf-ft.
Locate the upper wall mounting holes directly behind the driver rear sliding glass window pillar ( Fig. 146, Item 1).

Locate the shoulder harness assembly mounting bracket and insert the mounting bolts through the bracket and into the wall structure mounting holes, both upper and lower bracket assemblies ( Fig. 146, Items 2 and 3). Torque the mounting bolts to 40-42 Lbf-ft.

note.para: The installation of the floor mounted seat and barrier attachments can be located underneath the bus floor. An assistant is required to install the washers and lock nuts. Installation also requires torquing the fasteners to the specified values from under the bus body.

step1.para: Locate the barrier to be installed and place the inboard (rail mounting bracket) on the chair rail along the bus side wall.

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. SEAT / CHAIR RAIL MOUNTING BOLTS AND WASHERS

step1.para: Align the barrier wall bracket mounting holes on the chair rail ( Fig. 148, Item 4) mounting holes. Insert the mounting bolts ( Fig. 148, Item 5) through the barrier mounting bracket ( Fig. 148, Items 2) and chair rail (Item 4). Install the washers and lock nuts (Item 3).
Locate the barrier foot assembly ( Fig. 184) mounting holes and align with mounting holes in floor.

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. ROAD WARNING TRIANGLE MOUNTING BRACKET SCREWS

step1.para: Install the mounting bolts, washers and lock nuts as required and torque to specified value.
Install the entry assist handrail as required (if installing passenger side crash barrier).

svcsubproc.title: Fire Extinguisher
svcsubproc.para: The fire extinguisher installation may vary depending on location of the extinguisher. The extinguishers are generally mounted in the vertical position.

step1.para: Locate the area the extinguisher is to be mounted. Mark the bulkhead or area where the extinguisher bracket will be mounted. Use the bracket mounting holes as a guide. Drill the mounting holes or use the existing mounting holes.
Align the bracket mounting holes and bulkhead mounting holes, insert mounting screws and tighten.
Insert extinguisher in bracket and secure strap band.

svcsubproc.title: First Aid Kit
svcsubproc.para: The first aid kit provided for the school bus application is designed for use from the mounted position. The kit is furnished with an upper mounting bracket and a lower spring clip retainer.

step1.para: To mount the first aid kit locate the mounting holes in the overhead panel.

figure.caption: Figure 186. First Aid Kit mounting Clip and Screws

step1.para: Place the kit in on the lower bracket retainer assembly.
Insert the two mounting screws through the kit upper mounting flange and tighten the screw until the kit is snug.

svcsubproc.title: Body Fluid Clean-up Kit (Optional)
svcsubproc.para: The body fluid clean-up kit provided for the school bus application is designed for use from the mounted position. The kit is furnished with an upper mounting bracket and a lower spring clip retainer.

step1.para: To mount the Body fluid clean up kit locate the mounting holes in the overhead panel.
Place the kit in on the lower bracket retainer assembly.
Insert the two mounting screws through the kit upper mounting flange and tighten the screw until the kit is snug.

svcsubproc.title: Passenger Door Control Mechanism
svcsubproc.para: The CE 200 and CE 300 school bus models are equipped with one of three different style or type passenger entry door opener mechanisms. The standard door opening type is the electrically operated door opening mechanism. The second style is the optional air operated door opener and the third is a manual type door opener. All three types automatically activate the student warning lights, the crossing gate and driver side stop arms.

step1.para: Electric Actuated Door Opener Removal

The electric door opener motor and drive mechanism are located in the compartment directly above the passenger entry door. The door operation is activated by a double switch operation on the left side of the steering wheel. An optional two position switch is located on the left console switch panel. A manual override switch for emergency purposes is located on the door opener access panel. See bus operators manual for operational instructions.
To install the door opener use the following procedures:

step2.para: Locate and open the drive motor access door.
Locate the six motor mounting bolts holes that secure the motor mounting bracket to the compartment structure.
Install the door opener drive motor, and align with mounting holes in compartment.
Insert the six mounting bolts and tighten.
Locate and connect the harness plug at the upper left hand corner of the compartment.
Move the emergency release lever forward to release the emergency door.
Locate the drive arm on the cam gear plate.
Locate the drive arm and drive arm end bushing mounting hole.
Insert the mounting bolt through the bushing and gear plate.
Install the lock nut attaching the drive arm to the gear plate.
Tighten to required torque value.
Set emergency door switch to automatic.
Activate door from steering wheel switch. Check operation. If adjustment is required see door adjustment section of this manual.

step1.para: The passenger entry door has no speed adjustments. The doors do have a limit switch adjustment that sets the limits of the door opening. To adjust these limits loosen the mounting screws on the switch assembly. Move the switch in or out to set the limit of the door opening operation.

step2.para: To replace either switch, set the emergency manual door opener to open.

figure.caption: Figure 187. Electric Door Opener Adjustment- Limit Switches

step2.para: Locate the 2 Phillips head screws on the top surface of the switch. Loosen and remove screws.
Remove switch. With switch removed disconnect the wire connectors to switch. Mark switch for placement of wires when reinstalling.
Follow the same procedure for the opposite switch if it is to be replaced.

svcsubproc.para: The air actuated door control switch is located on the steering wheel or on the left console panel. The emergency release switch is a toggle switch located on the right wing console outboard section.

The air actuated door has four major components: the regulator, cylinder, door switch and the air valve. The actuator switch is located on the steering wheel assembly or on the driver console (depending on state specifications). The switch to actuate the dump feature is located to the right of the driver side dash. Some states may require the dump feature to be located in other positions.
The door speed can be adjusted at the air control valve. The air valve is located above the entrance door. To change the opening speed or closing speed follow the steps below:

figure.caption: Figure 188. Air Operated Door Adjustment Valve

item.para: Use a small tip slotted screwdriver.
Locate the "open" screw and turn clockwise to slow the speed down.
To increase the door opening speed, turn the slotted screw counter-clockwise.

svcsubproc.para: To change the close speed adjustment, use the steps below:

item.para: Locate the "close" screw and turn clockwise to slow.
To increase the opening speed, turn the slotted screw counter-clockwise

svcsubproc.para: The pressure regulator should be set at approximately 41 to 50 pounds of pressure.

item.para: To increase the pressure, turn the adjustment knob clockwise.
To reduce the pressure turn the knob counter-clockwise. In extreme cold, the pressure will need to be increased because seals may stiffen.

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. REGULATOR MOUNTING BRACKET AND JAM NUT

svcsubproc.para: The entrance door should take approximately four to five seconds to open and close depending on the speed setting.

note.para: Periodic maintenance is required to torque mounting nut and wire attachment screws.

svcsubproc.title: Bus Interior Light Bars
svcsubproc.para: The light bar assemblies along each side of the bus body above the passenger and driver windows contain the harness for the rear bus warning, stop-tail, directional and back-up lights. They also contain the wire harness for the emergency exit door buzzers, the roof escape hatches, emergency window exits, interior bus lighting and speaker assembly wiring (if equipped).

step1.para: Driver light bar. The driver light bar ( Fig. 55, Item 1) contains the harness and connections from the chassis and body electrical compartment.

step2.para: Place the light bar assembly in position over the driver window assembly. Align the mounting holes in the driver light bar and the passenger light bar assembly.
Check that the light bar cut out for the wire duct ( Fig. 55, Item 5) from the electrical compartment fits properly.
Install the Phillips head screw and tighten.

step1.para: Light bar panels

step2.para: The light bar panels ( Fig. 56) are located along the window line. The top flange of the light bar panel is attached to the ceiling panel.
Install the light panel behind the passenger window top flange.
Lay the upper light bar flange against the ceiling panel, insert the mounting screw and tighten.

step1.para: Passenger lights and speakers assemblies ( Fig. 56, Items 1 and 2).

step2.para: Passenger light assemblies are located above the window assemblies in the light bar.
If a light assembly is being replaced, locate the harness connection in the light bar for the light connection. Insert the light assembly connectors into the harness connector.
Place the light fixture and lens over the opening in the light bar.
Align the mounting holes and insert mounting screws.
Mounting the speaker assemblies in the light bar, locate the speaker wire connectors and attach the connectors.
Place the speaker assembly over the opening and align the four mounting screws.
Insert the screws and tighten.

step1.para: Light bar joint cover plate ( Fig. 154, Item 2)

step2.para: Locate the end sections of the two light bar panels ( Fig. 154, Item 3) and install the joint cover over the panel joints. Place the lower flange behind the window top flange. Insert mounting screw in top flange of joint cover into ceiling panel.
Follow the same procedure for all other joint cover plates.

step1.para: Corner covers ( Fig. 57, Item 2)
The corner cover light bar sections conceal the wire harness junction connectors at the rear corners of the bus body.

step2.para: When replacing the corner covers, ensure all harness connections are secured and out of the way.
Install the corner cover over the light bar end section and flush to the inside rear cap assembly.
Install the mounting screws and tighten.
Torque all mounting screws until tight. Do not over tighten.

svcsubproc.title: Seats
svcsubproc.para: If the seat has been removed for repairs and is being re-installed to the same position use this procedure;

para.emph: Seat Install. An assistant will be required to install the seat mounting bolts.

step2.para: Two leg / chair rail mount (30" and 45")

step3.para: Align seat wall bracket on chair rail, align the mounting holes on the chair rail and leg mounting holes on the floor.
Install the chair rail mounting bolts, washers and lock nuts. Tighten the chair rail fasteners.
Locate the chair leg floor plate mounting holes and insert the mounting bolts through the mounting plate and floor.
The mounting lock nuts and washers are installed from beneath the bus and torqued to 19-20 Lbf-ft by an assistant.

step2.para: Four leg (30" and 45")

step3.para: Locate the seat in position, aligning the mounting holes in the seat leg floor plate mounting holes with the floor mounting holes.
Insert the mounting bolts through the four leg mounting plates and floor.
The mounting lock nuts and washers are installed from beneath the bus and torqued to 19-20 Lbf-ft by an assistant.

step2.para: Child Safety seat (Optional)

step3.para: Follow the same procedure for standard rail mount seat and four leg seat as previously outlined in steps "a" and "b".

step2.para: Flip Up Emergency Exit Seat (Optional)
The flip up emergency exit seat is a four leg seat assembly.

step3.para: Follow the same procedure as described in section "b" of this section.

svcsubproc.title: Seat Cushions
svcsubproc.para: Inspect all seat mounting hardware attachments. This should be performed at 30 to 45 day intervals. Inspect the seat back foam around the upper corner and in the knee impact area. If damage is discovered such as breakage or separated seals, the seat back material should be replaced without delay.
The following procedure should be used to replace seat upholstery. In most cases the seat will not have to be removed from the bus.

step1.para: Locate the upholstery or foam on the seat board, align the foam, overlay the upholstery material and staple to the seat board.
Replace the seat board mounting hardware if necessary.
Align the seat cushion on the seat frame, insert mounting hardware screws, and tighten.
Insert the hinge mounting screws through the hinge assembly into seat cushion board. Tighten the screws.
Flip the cushion down to the ride position and rotate locking clip to secure seat cushion assembly.

With the seat cushion flipped forward, locate and install the seat back cushion (foam padding) over the seat back frame. Pull the foam panel all the way down over the frame work and ensure a tight fit.
Place the upholstery (seat back cover) section over the cushion and frame assembly and pull down into place.
Staple the material in place on the tack strip.
Check the end seams for adequate fit, flip seat cushion back down and lock in place.

svcsubproc.title: Seat Tracks (Optional)
svcsubproc.para: The seat track configuration may vary depending on the type seats and location.

step1.para: If the floor has a plywood sub-floor the plywood will be routed to accommodate the seat track as part of the floor assembly.
Locate the slots in the plywood sub-floor and insert the seat tracks in the floor slot.
Locate the mounting holes in the track section and drill through the mounting holes and sub-floor assembly.
Insert the tapered Phillips head torque lock screw in the track and fasten into the floor system.

After the track is mounted, ensure that a sufficient amount of undercoat has been applied to prevent moisture from penetrating the bus integrity on the underside of the bus floor where the mounting screws have penetrated through.
With the seat track in place install the flooring material as required.
Install the seat track mounting studs according to the requirements of the state or district specifications.
Mount the seats on the track and mounting studs. Install the lock nuts and torque to required value.

svcsubproc.title: Seat Belt- 2 Point With Seat Track (Optional)
svcsubproc.para: With the seat track and seats in place insert the seat belt track mounting studs in the appropriate position by inserting the head of the track bolt in the track and slide to lock position.

step1.para: Install seat belt ends through cushion and seat back and place end plate mounting hole on the seat track stud.
Install the stud mounting lock nut over the seat belt mounting plate and tighten.
Follow the same procedure for the remaining seat belt mounting plates on the respective mounting studs. Install lock nuts and torque.

svcsubproc.title: Passenger Window Installation
svcsubproc.para: Prior to installing the passenger side windows, inspect the window seat and frame for dirt, old sealant and/or debris. Clean as necessary.

note.para: Check the window gasket material for full adhesion around the window frame prior to installation. Any cracks or breaks in the seal could result in window leaks.

step1.para: Locate the window assembly in the window opening.

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. PASSENGER WINDOW EXTRUDED FRAME AND WINDOW ASSEMBLY

step1.para: Insert the window mounting cover plates each side of the window assembly. Install the mounting screws in the cover plates and tighten.
Check the window and seal for fit.
Apply sealant as may be required to ensure good seal and stop possibility of leaks.

svcsubproc.title: Stationary Glass Install
svcsubproc.para: All glass installed in this vehicle meets F.M.V.S.S. requirements. The glass should only be replaced with the same type glass. The passenger entry door glass is AS-2 tempered safety glass encased by an aluminum frame with a center latching device.

step1.para: Check the glass for cracks and or chips before installation process.
Place the "H" seal around the glass panel.
Place glass and seal in window frame area from inside the bus body. With a flat tool seat glass and seal on the window opening lip.
Spray the window and seal with a soapy solution to help in the installation of the window assembly.
Using the window flat tool work the seal around the window frame lip.
Check the inside of the window and seal to ensure the window has seated. Using the same flat tool work the seal around the window perimeter to ensure proper seat.
Insert the window seal lock lace around the window area seal.
A rope in method may be used in place of working the window perimeter with the flat tool.

svcsubproc.title: Emergency Exit Window Installation
svcsubproc.para: Prior to installing the emergency kick-out window assemblies, inspect the window seat and frame for dirt, old sealant and/or debris. Clean as necessary.

step1.para: Horizontally Hinged Kick-out Windows

step2.para: Locate and connect the wire lead to the switch assembly below the window frame.
Locate the plunger switch and install the four mounting screws at the bottom of the window frame that secure the switch in place.
Locate the window assembly in the window opening.
Locate the plunger switch and install the four mounting screws on the bottom of the window frame that secure the switch in place.
Insert the window mounting cover plates each side of the window assembly. Install the mounting screws in the cover plates and tighten.
Verify the window buzzer operation.

step1.para: Vertically Hinged Kick-out Windows

step2.para: Locate and connect the wire lead to the switch assembly on the vertical window frame.
Locate the plunger switch and install the four mounting screws on the side of the window frame that secure the switch in place.
Locate the window assembly in the window opening.
Insert the window mounting cover plates each side of the window assembly. Install the mounting screws in the cover plates and tighten.
Verify the window buzzer operation.

svcsubproc.title: Emergency Exit Doors and Latches
svcsubproc.para: If the emergency door latch has been removed or replaced use the following procedure to install door latches:

step1.para: Locate the interior door latch mechanism and install on door structure.
Align the four mounting screws on the door latch assembly with mounting holes on the interior door panel.
Locate the exterior door handle mounting plate on the exterior of the door handle panel. Install the two mounting screws to secure the mounting bracket.
Install the exterior door handle assembly on the mechanism rod.
Locate and tighten the torque head screws at the top of the handle and the other set screw (torque head) on the side of the handle stem.
Check the mechanism latch for proper operation and ensure the lock mechanism is lubricated.
With the ignition in the "ON" position, check the door buzzer for proper alignment and operation.

svcsubproc.title: Emergency Roof Hatch Exit Install
svcsubproc.para: If the roof hatch has been removed due to external damage and is being replaced, it is recommended that only OEM replacement parts be used in the installation procedure.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or death always use a secure scaffold assembly and safety restraints or equivalent equipment when servicing the bus roof panels or roof component accessories. An assistant should be present during any roof or roof accessory repair procedures.

step1.para: Locate the replacement roof escape hatch over the roof opening and align the mounting holes in the hatch assembly with the mounting holes in the roof.
Apply adhesive or sealer under the perimeter of the hatch assembly prior to fastening the hatch to the roof.
Use 1/4" diameter replacement rivets of suitable length. Use a rivet gun of industrial quality to properly set rivets.
Install a pliable sealant around the outside perimeter of the hatch to prevent possible leakage.
Install the plastic fastener protective caps over the rivets.
From inside the bus, locate the hatch buzzer wire harness and connect to the body harness plug.
Locate the inside hatch trim ring into the hatch opening in the ceiling. Align the trim ring mounting holes with the existing ceiling panel mounting holes.
Insert the mounting screws through the hatch trim ring and tighten.
Install the screw cap covers on the interior trim ring.
Close the hatch assembly, turn ignition key to the "ON" position and open hatch to verify the alarm operation.

svcsubproc.title: WheelChair Access Door (Optional)
svcsubproc.para: The wheelchair access door is mounted to the bus body structure with three 180 degree swing hinges.

note.para: An assistant may be required to locate the wheel chair access door in the door opening.

step1.para: Locate the door assembly in the door opening with the hinges mounted on the door assembly.
Align the hinge mounting holes with the body mounting holes.
Insert the mounting bolts in the hinge assemblies, tighten and swing door to check alignment.
If the door seats properly, torque hinge mounting bolts.
Open the door and check the door ajar alarm alignment.
Close the door assembly, turn ignition key to the "ON" position and open the door to verify the alarm operation.

svcsubproc.title: Wheelchair Lift
svcsubproc.para: The wheelchair lift is a specialized accessory and only a trained technician should attempt the installation of the wheelchair lift assembly. Refer to the manufacturer service manual for installation and servicing procedures.

svcsubproc.title: Wheelchair Floor Plates
svcsubproc.para: Locate the wheelchair plates on the floor where desired. Check all dimensions relative to the placement of the wheelchair and related components.

step1.para: Mark the wheelchair mounting plate holes on the floor. Drill the holes to proper size.
Install the four carriage bolts per plate as required.
With an assistant locate the mounting bolts from underneath the bus body, install the washers and lock nuts.
Tighten lock nuts with torque wrench to the required torque value.

svcsubproc.title: Wheelchair Seat Belts and Shoulder Harness
svcsubproc.para: Locate the seat belt harness track mounting holes above the window assemblies.

step1.para: Align the track mounting holes with the window header mounting and ceiling panel holes.
Insert the torque head mounting screws and tighten to the required torque value.
Locate the wall mounted shoulder / seat belt storage bag mounting holes in the lower interior side sheet.
Install the six mounting screws and tighten.

svcsubproc.title: Emergency Door Glass Protection Screen (Optional)
svcsubproc.para: Locate the emergency door protection screen and place over the lower glass panel.

step1.para: Set the screen in the lower clips center on the window opening. Rotate the remaining clips around to capture the screen frame.
Tighten the mounting clips.
Align the clips on the screen and tighten the mounting screws.

svcsubproc.title: Emergency Door and Wheelchair Access Door Glass Install
svcsubproc.para: This procedure is for all stationary glass panels excluding the windshield assembly. This includes passenger entry doors, emergency exit doors, wheelchair access doors and destination board lighted glass panel.
Follow the procedure below to install the stationary glass panels.
The procedure for installation of the stationary glass panels includes passenger entry doors, wheelchair lift access door and rear or side emergency exit doors.

To ease installation, the rubber gasket can be heated with a non-flame source (heat gun). At high temperatures, the rubber gasket is more pliable. Do not heat above 125 deg. F for longer than 1 1/2 hours.

step1.para: For smaller glass applications, install the glass in the window seal and set on the lower flange.
Utilizing the hook end of the glass installation tool work the seal and glass into the opening.

figure.caption: Figure 194. Emergency Exit Door and Wheelchair Door Glass Replace

step1.para: A foam type glass cleaner or soapy fluid can be used to lubricate the rubber gasket. This will ease the installation of the window and seal.
To install the lock lace into the window seal use a lacing tool (# 201-1127) by Sommer Maca. Thread lace rubber through tool into the window seal.
Push or pull the rubber around the rubber gasket, feeding the lace rubber into the tool using a hitching motion. This will help prevent the lace rubber from stretching.
Inspect the installation and clean off the surface of the glass.
Seal the rubber gasket and glass with a pliable windshield sealant.

svcsubproc.title: Safety Equipment (Required)
svcsubproc.para: Road reflective triangles and storage box are a safety requirement on all busses. These are generally stored in a plastic case mounted directly behind the driver position on the crash barrier bulkhead.

step1.para: Locate the reflector mounting case bracket on the lower frame of the driver crash barrier bulkhead.
Align the mounting holes in the mounting bracket with the mounting holes in the barrier lower frame.

figure.caption: Figure 195. Road Hazard Triangle Mounting Bracket

step1.para: Insert the mounting screws through the bracket into the barrier frame.
Tighten the bracket mounting screw.

svcsubproc.title: Exterior Light Monitor (Optional)
svcsubproc.para: Locate and position the exterior light check module. Connect the harness connections as may be required.

step1.para: Align the monitor mounting holes with the mounting holes located in the driver bulkhead.
Insert the mounting screws and tighten.
Turn ignition switch to the "ON" position, and check the light monitor for full function.
If the monitor works properly, torque the mounting screws to required torque values.
If the monitor does not function properly, remove and check harness connections.
Re-install the monitor assembly and torque mounting screws.

svcsubproc.title: Fuel Sender Access Panel
svcsubproc.para: To replace center aisle fuel sender access panel, follow procedure below.

step1.para: Place the fuel access panel over the opening in the center aisle floor.
Align the holes in the access plate with the holes in the center aisle flooring and insert the mounting screws in the access panel.
Tighten all the screws around the access panel. Ensure that no sharp edges are protruding upward that might cause any kind of obstacle in the aisle way.
With the access panel under a passenger seat, the seat should have already been removed during the access panel removal procedure.
Follow the same procedure as in steps 3 and 4.

With an assistant locate the seat removed, align the chair rail mounting holes with the mounting holes on the chair bracket. Insert the mounting bolts, nuts and washers through the chair bracket and chair rail. Hand tighten.
With an assistant under the bus floor, locate the mounting foot holes in the chair and align with the mounting holes in the bus floor.
Insert the mounting bolts and the assistant will install the washers and lock nuts. Tighten the chair mounting bolts and nuts to the proper torque value.
Torque the chair rail mounting hardware to the required torque value.

svcsubproc.title: Flooring
svcsubproc.para: If an area of the bus floor is to be replaced, measure the area using the removed piece as a template.

step1.para: Prior to installing the flooring adhesive, make sure the floor and or sub- floor is clean and free of any debris.
Replace the flooring that was removed with the new cut to fit piece.
Using a floor rolling tool, roll the surface of the flooring in a continuous motion, covering the entire area replaced and including the seams. Let the flooring set up.
If the floor was replaced under a row of seats, locate the chair rail holes of the seat and mark the floor accordingly.
Drill the flooring at the marks made and install the mounting bolts.
If the entire floor area must be replaced all seats must be removed and the sub-floor checked for damage if applicable.
If the sub floor requires replacement, remove the sub-floor prior to installation of the new sub-floor. Plug all holes in the floor structure.
Seal the floor structure and place adhesive. Place the new sub-floor plywood and screw into place.
Follow the same procedure installing the floor covering as was done in the repair procedure.
Re-drill the floor seat mounting holes.
Install the seats and torque all hardware as required.
Torque all fasteners from beneath the bus. All protruding screws and mounting bolts should be coated to prevent corrosion and/or leaks.
